alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Herkimer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 10:19AM EST until January 14 at 10:45AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Hamilton County in eastern New York... Central Herkimer County in eastern New York... * Until 1045 AM EST. * At 1018 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Nicks Lake Campground to Alder Creek to near Lee, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Old Forge, Limekiln Lake Campground, McKeever, Northwood, Nicks Lake Campground, Nobleboro, Atwell, Wheelertown, Minnehaha, Thendara, First Lake, Herkimer Landing, Caswell Lake, Wilmurt, Sagamore, Wolf Lake Landing, Wilmurt Corners, Mountain Lodge, Sagamore Lake, and North Wilmurt. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
